meanings.definition: To produce a color print using multiple lithographic stones, each carrying a different color ink.
meanings.sent1: The artist chromolithographed a beautiful landscape with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent2: The company chromolithographed posters for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student chromolithographed their face with rainbow colors during art class.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were chromolithographed in vivid hues, like a painting come to life.
meanings.sent5: The sunset chromolithographed the sky with shades of pink and orange, creating a breathtaking scene.

meanings.sent1: She admired the chromolithograph hanging in the art gallery.
meanings.sent2: The collector added a rare chromolithograph to their collection.
meanings.sent3: The old book contained a beautifully detailed chromolithograph of a tropical bird.
meanings.sent4: The chromolithograph of the cityscape captured the essence of urban life.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed a stunning chromolithograph of a famous painting, showcasing the intricate details.
